JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE ORG ( ORG “ the Fund ” ) granted to a limited liability company wholly owned by the applicant a state guarantee , as it was exporting its products to GPE . On CARDINAL DATE the company transferred all its rights related to the above - mentioned guarantee to a bank . The transfer was confirmed by ORG on DATE . Later the bank set off the amount of the guarantee from the company ’s account without the applicant ’s approval . Civil proceedings were instituted against the bank in relation to the state guarantee in question . On DATE ORG ( korkein hallinto - oikeus , högsta förvaltningsdomstolen ) gave a final decision in which the set off was approved by the court .

The applicant apparently learned about the above - mentioned ORG decision for the first time on DATE . He immediately requested that the proceedings be reopened as ORG had failed to communicate to him a statement which it had received from the ORG during the first part of the proceedings . ORG rejected the applicant ’s request on DATE , finding that even though the court had indeed failed to communicate the document in question , the proceedings had been in conformity with the law as in force at the time .
On DATE the applicant and another person gave a directly enforceable guarantee to cover the debt of the applicant ’s company . The debt fell due on DATE and was not paid .
On DATE the creditor bank initiated civil proceedings in ORG ( käräjäoikeus , tingsrätten ) requesting the company , the applicant and the third person to pay the debt .
On DATE the creditor bank requested that the applicant ’s assets be sequestrated . ORG granted the sequestration order on DATE .

On DATE ORG asked the defendants to indicate clearly in writing whether or not they contested the claim at the risk of a default judgment . The applicant and his co - defendants filed their statements of reply on DATE respectively but failed to indicate clearly their position . On DATE the ORG gave a default judgment in which it ordered the applicant and his co - defendants to pay the debt . The judgment was served on DATE .

On DATE the applicant and his co - defendants lodged an appeal against the default judgment with ORG requesting a stay of execution and that the default judgment be quashed and the claims of the creditor bank be rejected . On DATE ORG ordered a stay of execution of the default judgment .

Meanwhile , the applicant also lodged a procedural complaint with ORG ( hovioikeus , hovrätten ) , requesting that the default judgment be quashed . On DATE ORG stayed the execution of the default judgment . On DATE the court dismissed the complaint without considering the merits as the case was still pending before ORG . The stay of execution given by the court on DATE expired .

The ORG proceedings comprised CARDINAL different sets of civil proceedings , namely the applicant ’s claim for a refund of benefit by unjust enrichment , the appeal against the default judgment and an action for damages , which was subsequently withdrawn . ORG asked the creditor bank to submit its replies by DATE and CARDINAL DATE . The applicant was asked to give his reply by CARDINAL DATE but this time - limit was extended several times until DATE . A preparatory hearing was scheduled for DATE but it was cancelled as the applicant had brought a criminal action for aggravated abuse of public office against the presiding judge . These charges were subsequently found manifestly ill - founded .

Another judge was appointed to the case . In DATE the creditor bank proposed that , in order to avoid partiality issues , the matter be adjudicated in a formation of CARDINAL judges instead of CARDINAL and that the judges be appointed jointly with ORG . Later on the parties , however , gave their consent to the single judge composition . The CARDINAL sets of civil proceedings were joined on DATE .

In DATE the applicant requested that an oral hearing concerning the criminal proceedings , which related to the bankruptcy proceedings of the company and which were pending before the same court , be held before an oral hearing in the civil proceedings . Despite this request , the preparatory hearings in the civil proceedings were held on DATE and DATE . On DATE the applicant indicated that if no oral hearing was held in the criminal case before an oral hearing was held in the civil case , he would bring a criminal action against the presiding judge . On DATE he brought such action for abuse of public office against the presiding judge which he later , however , abandoned . A continued preparatory hearing and the oral hearing in the civil case were held in DATE .

On DATE the ORG quashed the default judgment and rejected the creditor bank ’s claims as far as the applicant was concerned . As far as the company was concerned , the court rejected its appeal and upheld the default judgment . The stay of execution given by the court on DATE expired .

In DATE all parties to the case appealed to ORG . The applicant ’s appeal only concerned costs and expenses . The company requested that the default judgment be quashed and that the claims of the creditor bank be rejected .

On DATE ORG stayed the execution of ORG judgment . In DATE and DATE the applicant was asked to supplement his appeal , which he did on DATE and DATE respectively . DATE and DATE the applicant continually submitted letters to the court at DATE intervals .

The court held a preparatory hearing on DATE . On DATE , DATE before the scheduled oral hearing , the applicant entered a disqualification plea against the presiding judge of the court . This plea was rejected as manifestly ill - founded during the oral hearing on DATE .

On DATE ORG accepted the applicant ’s appeal and he was freed from the obligation to pay costs and expenses . For the rest , the court upheld ORG judgment . The stay of execution given by the court on DATE expired .
The applicant and the company appealed to ORG ( korkein oikeus , högsta domstolen ) . On DATE ORG refused leave to appeal .
